content.text: 1 Find the median of these numbers.
2 In triangle \(A B C, A C=21 \mathrm{~m}\) and \(B C=15.9 \mathrm{~m}\).
Using a ruler and compasses only, complete the scale drawing of the triangle. Use a scale of 1 cm to represent 3 m .
The side \(A B\) is drawn for you.

table.html:
\(\frac{2}{5}\)
\(\sqrt{15}\)
23
\(\sqrt{144}\)
-2

content.text: From this list, write down
(a) a natural number
(b) an irrational number.
4 The diagram shows a pentagon made from two congruent trapeziums.
NOT TO SCALE
The area of the pentagon is \(130.2 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
Calculate the value of \(x\).
5 (a) Convert \(780 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) into \(\mathrm{m}^{2}\).
(b) Convert \(0.037 \mathrm{~m}^{3}\) into \(\mathrm{cm}^{3}\).
\(\mathrm{cm}^{3}\)
6 One titanium atom has a mass of \(7.95 \times 10^{-23}\) grams.
Calculate the number of titanium atoms in 1 kg of titanium. Give your answer in standard form.
\(7 \ \%=\{x: x\) is an integer and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 12\}\) \(E=\) {even numbers} \(M=\) {multiples of 3}
(a) Find \(\mathrm{n}(M)\).
(b) Write down the set \(E \cap M\).
(c) \(y \in(E \cup M)^{\prime}\)
Write down a possible value of \(y\).
8 Factorise.
9 (a) Simplify.
Find the value of \(n\).
10 Expand and simplify.

content.text: Find the value of \(k\).
13 Line \(L\) has the equation \(y=2(x-5)\).
(a) Find the coordinates of the point where line \(L\) intersects the \(y\)-axis.
(b) Find the \(x\)-coordinate of the point where line \(L\) intersects the line \(y=19\).
(c) Line \(P\) is perpendicular to line \(L\). Line \(P\) passes through the point \((2,3)\).
Find the equation of line \(P\). Give your answer in the form \(y=m x+c\).
14 Jess invests \(\$ 1400\) in an account. The account pays compound interest at a rate of \(r \%\) per year.
At the end of 4 years the value of her investment is \(\$ 1523.15\).
Find the value of \(r\).
15 \(m\) is inversely proportional to the square root of \((t+2)\). \(m=0.5\) when \(t=23\).
Find \(m\) when \(t=98\).
By shading the unwanted regions of the grid, draw and label the region \(R\) which satisfies these three inequalities.
17 In the Venn diagram, shade the region \((A \cup B) \cap C^{\prime}\).
NOT TO SCALE
The diagram shows a solid cuboid with sides of length 4.5 cm , 8 cm and 13.2 cm .
(a) Calculate the volume of the cuboid.
(b) Calculate the total surface area of the cuboid.
\(\mathrm{cm}^{2}\)
NOT TO SCALE
Calculate the angle between \(A B\) and the horizontal base of the cuboid.

content.text: (a) Draw a cumulative frequency diagram to show this information.
(b) Find an estimate of the 75th percentile.
cm [1]
20 Stephan has two bags, \(A\) and \(B\), each containing red sweets and yellow sweets only. He picks two sweets at random, one from bag \(A\) and the other from bag \(B\).
The probability that Stephan picks a red sweet from bag \(A\) is \(\frac{3}{5}\). The probability that Stephan picks a red sweet from bag \(A\) and a red sweet from bag \(B\) is \(\frac{2}{15}\).
(a) Find the probability that Stephan picks a red sweet from bag \(B\).
(b) Find the probability that Stephan picks a yellow sweet from bag \(A\) and a yellow sweet from bag \(B\).
22 A metal cube has mass 14.2 g , correct to 1 decimal place.
(a) Find the lower bound of the mass of the cube.
(b) The side length of the cube is 1.3 cm , correct to 1 decimal place.
Calculate the upper bound of the density of the metal. [Density = mass \(\div\) volume \(]\)
NOT TO SCALE
The diagram shows a frustum made by removing a small cone from a large cone. The height of the small cone is 7.5 cm .
The height of the frustum is 4.5 cm . The radius of the large cone is 4.2 cm .
Work out the volume of the frustum.
24 The histogram shows information about the distance some people travel to work.
(a) Use the histogram to complete the table.

table.html:
Distance (dkm)
Number of people
\(0
\(5
\(20

content.text: (b) The people who travel a distance greater than 35 km to work have a car allowance.
Calculate an estimate of the number of these people who have a car allowance.
25 (a) Sketch the graph of \(y=\sin x\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).
(b) Solve the equation \(2+5 \sin x=1\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\).
NOT TO SCALE
The diagram shows a quadrilateral \(O X P Y\) with diagonals meeting at \(T\). \(O X=3 \mathbf{a}\) and \(O Y=12 \mathbf{b}\).
(a) Find \(\overrightarrow{X Y}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\).
(b) \(X T: T Y=1: 2\) and \(\overrightarrow{Y P}=5 \mathbf{a}-2 \mathbf{b}\).
Find the ratio \(O T: P T\).
